page.title: 10Farm Survey (cont)
page.content:
... sheep scab and foot and mouth disease. To prevent these the sheep have two compulsory dips a year. The chief items of machinery are ten tractors and two large combine harvesters. The farm grows wheat, barley and hay for their own animals.
We visited Dean Hill Barn Farm on Monday 15th July. This is a farm for beef production. The farmer buys Fresian Bulls and Limousin steers because they are best suited to his system. Barley is grown on the farm for the cattle and harvested, dried and rolled on site. In winter cattle are fed on silage stored in the middle of their winter quarters. Their feeding is controlled by an electric fence. The bulls are kept inside, never allowed to graze. The steers are strip grazed using an electric fence.
